headline.main: Submarine Hero a Deceptively Meek Man, Says Professor Who Was His Boyhood Pal

lead_paragraph: Lieut. Comdr. Thomas Burton Klakring, the audacious submarine skipper who sank eight Japanese ships within sight of Japan's ports, was described yesterday as a man who was gentle, calm and meek on the surface but who became hard, thorough and vicious when engaged in any contest.
abstract: Lt Comdr T B Klakring described
